text: Drenge are an English three-piece rock band made up of Eoin Loveless, on guitar and vocals, his younger brother Rory, on drums, and Rob Graham on bass. The brothers grew up in Castleton, Derbyshire, where they formed the band in 2010, relocating to Sheffield in 2014. They have released two albums, Drenge in 2013 and Undertow in 2015. ==Albums== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of studio albums, with selected chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! scope="col" colspan="2"| Peak chart positions |- !style="width:3em;font-size:80%;"| UK !style="width:3em;font-size:80%;"| BEL |- ! scope="row"| Drenge | * Released: 19 August 2013 * Label: Infectious * Formats: CD, LP, digital download | style="text-align:center;"|42 | style="text-align:center;"|— |- ! scope="row"| Undertow | * Released: 6 April 2015 * Label: Infectious * Formats: CD, LP, digital download | style="text- align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|196 |- ! scope="row"| Strange Creatures | * Released: 22 February 2019 * Label: Infectious | 52 || — |- | colspan="4" style="text-align:center; font-size:8pt;"| "—" denotes albums that did not chart. |} ===Live albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of live albums ! scope="col" style="width:10em;"| Title ! scope="col" style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| iTunes Festival 2013 | * Released: 13 September 2013 * Label: Infectious * Format: Digital download |} ==Extended plays== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of EPs ! scope="col" style="width:10em;"| Title ! scope="col" style="width:18em;"| EP details |- ! scope="row"| Autonomy | * Released: 5 October 2018 * Label: Infectious * Formats: CD, digital download |} ==Singles== *"Bloodsports" (04/03/2013) on Infectious MusiciTunes page for track listing *"Backwaters" (17/05/2013) on Infectious MusiciTunes page for track listing *"Face Like a Skull" (19/07/2013)The Guardian article for release date on Infectious MusiciTunes page for track listing ==References== Category:Discographies of British artists Category:Rock music discographies
